summary: The Employee Ownership Financing Act aims to promote employee ownership in U.S. companies. It establishes an Office of Employee Ownership within the Department of Labor, creates a loan program providing loans and guarantees to employee stock ownership plans and worker-owned cooperatives, and mandates an offer for employee purchase in the event of a plant closing. Additionally, it establishes an Advisory Council on Employee Ownership.  The bill also includes provisions for employee rights during plant closures and sets authorization for appropriations.
